31fbc0d6-20e5-5735-861f-83a7eef1fd62.title: Frequency: For each element, prior to Works commencing

23b91cce-8ae7-5338-b8b3-f69141701c7e.title: Cracks to be determined either as active or inactive.

37a84f81-92f8-5dcf-a84a-fba806091c09.title: >0.2mm - shall be repaired via Routing and Sealing.

f93058be-4e2b-53f4-85ec-06db6617de95.title: Acceptance Criteria: Repair of cracks shall not be undertaken unless the cracked concrete structure has been assessed and the influence of cracks on load bearing capacity, serviceability and durability has been evaluated by the Contractor, and reviewed by the Superintendent.

0a2152f1-7c92-5807-9088-bb4b71764132.title: >0.2mm - shall be repaired via Resin Injection, Routing and Sealing or Gravity Feed method.

1a1e35b4-b666-549c-acc5-77274838d075.title: <0.2mm - May be coated by protective coating system provided they are not associated with earth or water retaining concrete components.

bd63ec34-e532-5b3e-b023-f7c6af9106a4.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl.687.01 CI.687.09 (a) Cl.610.24 (b)

7b128d95-bc85-5664-b181-009b3f643a98.title: Frequency: For each repair methodology, 14 days prior to Works commencing

5cf69cbe-a077-5b01-ac39-3777ba82d0e4.title: Acceptance Criteria: Crack repair procedure should be submitted prior to repairs being undertaken and must be approved by the Superintendent. Repair of cracks shall not be undertaken unless the cracked concrete structure has been assessed and the influence of cracks on load bearing capacity, serviceability and durability has been evaluated by FH and reviewed by the Superintendent.

9fef23f9-c248-5ae2-80f1-1070d0614052.title: Note: For the resin injection or gravity fed applications only.

e71a309e-fac6-5d6e-a009-4d917182c08d.title: Record of Conformity: Document evidence of adequate experience

2d94f058-7d17-55b0-a1cb-1a5c7113929d.title: Frequency: Once, for each personnel, prior to starting Works

4a111943-9e93-53f5-bf20-54aa977448fe.title: Acceptance Criteria: Personnel undertaking the concrete repair works shall have a minimum of 5 years experience in application. Documented evidence to be available.

e336af7a-3ea9-50ee-8358-c33564aca521.title: Note: This ITP does not cover special purpose, multi-component injection pumps.

320ed45f-7834-5afc-9c81-1e6e7a788534.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl.687.06 (a) CI.687.09 (c) (iii)

d2284902-5137-560f-9d84-47520f3c037d.title: Acceptance Criteria: Injection equipment to be simple, easy to handle guns with pressure regulation or limitations in the operating range and be simple to clean and maintain.

077603b8-9105-5e95-a63a-1e9ecfbc0e7c.title: Nipples/entry ports to have shut off valves or at least the ability to be capped to prevent leaks or air travelling back into the crack. Resin adhesive injection shall be performed continuously until cracks are completely filled. If port to port travel of resin adhesive is not indicated, the work shall cease immediately and the Superintendent notified.

04f6ca95-2c34-531e-af6f-48af073e8aa2.title: Frequency: Once, prior to starting the Works

4a01de9a-97ce-5ed6-a915-827bf983191e.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl.687.05 CI.687.09 (c) (i)

9984b987-66b8-53f0-bc9c-2f4d545db26e.title: Acceptance Criteria: Repairs are not to be undertaken when the ambient temperature is below 5°C or 5°C on a falling thermometer, or above 35°C.

d85494ea-07ad-5374-9423-c0c0965d6195.title: Where re-injection is required, this shall be carried out within the temperature-dependent period of the crack filling material given in the directions for use by the manufacturer. At high ambient temperatures, the use of cooling to influence the workability time of materials in containers is permissible.

aacbc3b4-b9a0-5642-a86b-8aaf839430c0.title: Cooling the materials is allowed should the need arise if temperatures inadvertently rise during the repairs.

f2320494-55f8-55e7-bbd8-f6f8e765bfd6.title: Where cracks and surrounding areas have been moistened during the cleaning process, sufficient time or accelerated drying-out needs to occur unless the crack repair materials are water tolerant

ad67c6f8-1fbe-5048-a3e8-a59e6bcddf3a.title: Acceptance Criteria: Cracks and surfaces located within 50mm each side of the crack to be cleaned of all loose particles, dirt, dust, curing compounds, grease or efflorescence by appropriate means (i.e. oil-free compressed air, industrial vacuum cleaners or flushing with high pressure water). Impurities, which inhibit wetting and adhesion or penetration by the crack filling material, shall be removed.

f858a76e-cc44-5622-8514-6500914a1a33.title: Acceptance Criteria: Approved procedure to be followed, steps to witness:

ad5ef80f-0c41-59d9-97e8-967851c274db.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl.687.09 CI.687.14 (a) CI.687.15 Product TDS

97acbfec-c5dc-5ae3-bfef-e28028ce5066.title: vi. Initiate the injection, applying pressure until resin can be witnessed entering the next nipple/entry port;

e3db8922-7c64-549e-883c-04918f2dbadd.title: vii. Stop pressure and close the valve of the engaged nipple/entry port and connect to the nipple/entry port where the resin appeared, working either upwards (for vertical cracks) or along the crack (for horizontal cracks) until all nipples/entry ports have been filled;

49afc31b-e6ae-5525-8fbc-a13c3ecea1c0.title: v. Once the epoxy mortar or paste has fully set, connect the injection gun to the lowest nipple/entry port (for vertical cracks) or at one end of the crack (for horizontal cracks);

3f81ca93-3782-5498-a14b-395cf852bc77.title: i. All materials in date and mixed as per the Product TDS;

a812d621-6ebe-5ed0-87cb-d76ea2b38eb4.title: iii. Nipple/entry port placement central over the cracks at 200mm spacings maximum (where cracks are through the full section, nipple/entry port placement shall stagger);

43953c9c-4fea-5d91-aad7-486774c75907.title: ii. Each nipple/entry port coated in epoxy mortar or paste to create a water-tight seal to the entire perimeter;

ca8645e1-82e0-5774-9761-6b50d57618a7.title: iix. Repair to be protected from damage or adverse weather while curing;

a006e429-816c-5d7e-9ffa-fd788c5ecb91.title: iv. Epoxy mortar or paste applied to the surface of the crack in between nipples/entry ports and the full height of the crack if within tolerance to eliminate resin leakage);

47754e77-6a66-58bf-afc7-faa1abbb823c.title: iv. Bond-breaking tape to be placed at the base of the chase/reservoir to limit sealant interface to 2 no. faces;

e9774f7e-326d-54a2-a01c-c919a5ad8c58.title: v. Where required, masking tape to sides of the adjacent surface to create a neat finish;

3a2e0463-6e3b-56af-8c5d-00dddde80f2a.title: iii Surface dust to be removed;

7a3160de-1afd-5d50-886c-4030d4a9dea8.title: vii. Product shaped with a suitable tool to recommended profile;

a88ee68e-7f4f-5590-9b55-881edeeaaec3.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl.687.10 (b) (ii) CI.687.15 Product TDS

80e86a88-2611-5762-bd38-4f141b00735d.title: iix. Repair to be protected from damage or adverse weather while curing;

98ffafe9-d27c-5cf9-915b-7c9c16e3f3cc.title: Acceptance Criteria: Approved procedure to be followed, steps to witness:

31beff94-20c0-5ec8-bffc-8c275e246b80.title: vi. Sealant gunned or tooled into the saw cut to completely fill the void;

a30457ad-8983-52a5-bf6e-64d74843ef26.title: ii. Saw cuts to be at a width to depth ratio of 2:1 and rectangular in section;

bc8be5af-1e79-58e4-a561-76b920e90262.title: i. All materials in date and mixed as per the Product TDS;

5f65c104-140b-5b44-948a-54f47d11ae8c.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl.687.10 (b) (i) CI.687.15 Product TDS

393e0e1c-87a9-5443-adce-8d17e3ee4349.title: iii. Surface dust to be removed;

4696cff1-aae4-5fa1-a54f-9b3ab46a313a.title: vi. Repair to be protected from damage or adverse weather while curing;

05b3cd35-bab0-50b9-88dc-1e62fb9c4531.title: i. All materials in date and mixed as per the Product TDS;

00c4ecd8-5f1c-5769-8622-c7a2548e6daa.title: Acceptance Criteria: Approved procedure to be followed, steps to witness:

594637b7-1a37-5628-933f-cadeb04d1e69.title: ii. Saw cuts to be at a minimum width and depth of 10mm and V-shaped in section;

beb72d50-3aa2-5a2d-9389-f71f484bc116.title: iv. Epoxy mortar / paste placed into the saw cut to completely fill the void;

c4bf6ac4-47b0-53f3-b341-fbbb4b312ac2.title: v. Product finished flush with the surrounding surface;

meta.name: 5.3 - Routing and Sealing: Inactive Crack Repairs

6b811510-57d4-5606-925a-3f12a69bad48.title: iv. Excess material and reservoir can be removed as the epoxy resin gels;

d736769d-ce83-573c-9510-64cb17a74fe1.title: iii. Epoxy resin to be poured onto the crack and either sufficient amount contained in the reservoir (if used) or worked back and forth by suitable means (such as a broom) until no more material can be absorbed;

748b3e61-14b9-59e1-a197-aebd38574d94.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl.687.11 (b) CI.687.15 Product TDS

b99f1ec6-98f6-5d93-b1ab-2bb2d2adc195.title: i. All materials in date and mixed as per the Product TDS;

c4006f10-0ff5-551e-90a8-9cdd2e8de996.title: ii. Where required, a water-tight reservoir, to be created with silicone or polyurethane sealant;

790a2181-e9f5-52be-9f52-3068d440746c.title: v. Repair to be protected from damage or adverse weather while curing;

e3add9b5-ec44-599d-b0ed-7f99a9d2427d.title: Acceptance Criteria: Approved procedure to be followed, steps to witness:

dafc7e44-7bdc-5c93-944a-4dfe748b5b73.title: vi. Repair to be protected from damage or adverse weather while curing;

7f725786-96e1-5adf-bc91-040ea734ef12.title: i. All materials in date and mixed as per the Product TDS;

64b4b55b-1c93-5881-985d-e7bf1513ca14.title: iii. Application rates to be as per the TDS for each type of product ensuring wet appearance;

665d5d82-5b25-527d-a035-6fc01466b6b2.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. CI.687.15 Product TDS

519bf71a-7bea-5047-9b71-eb802ac9fc0c.title: v. Repair to be protected from damage or adverse weather while curing

e3374cf5-4545-5db7-b45c-d09e9b204a9f.title: Acceptance Criteria: Approved procedure to be followed, steps to witness:

9e13cfde-ce7c-5394-94b4-075ee15e3dca.title: ii. Silane to be applied with an airless sprayer (for penetrant) or brush (for Solid Silane or Silane Crème) , working from low to high areas and approximately 150mm beyond the extent of the crack;

meta.name: 5.6 - Penetrant Coating Method: Inactive Cracks <0.2mm Width Repairs

189e9e9c-c452-561b-915b-d38ee7c8c06c.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. CI.687.15 Product TDS

df66dae4-79c9-516e-964a-5adeeaab8dec.title: Acceptance Criteria: After the repair materials have cured in accordance with the manufacturer's recommendations, any surface seal, nipples/entry ports and repair materials can be removed by suitable means.

62e6b7ea-8842-563b-b72b-c8cc9658a968.title: The surface shall be ground smooth, leaving no traces (indentations or protrusions) of a repair and if the repair location remains exposed, a fairing coat can be applied where not being coated with a pigmented coating system.

0a3feee4-c616-5d8c-accb-569b5a9297a0.title: Cores to be located in conjunction with a covermeter to avoid reinforcement and approved by the Nominated Authority.

522c5a57-c71d-59ed-b20c-3639a9a52e8b.title: 2 no. cores for the first 25m of crack and an additional 1 no. core sample for each 50m of crack or part thereof.

e016bfe1-4535-58ae-9d7e-837cb825204f.title: Complete: Structural Concrete Cementitious Repair ITP

e83233b2-1fb9-5142-84c1-0bb8909f6929.title: Core holes to be filled as per the cementitious repair ITP.

e0a3a04c-32af-51ef-890b-48d364e3a971.title: Acceptance Criteria: After 7 days minimum, 75mmØ core samples shall be taken to verify cracks are fully sealed.
